00022 #include <FdoStd.h>
00023 
00024 class FdoPhysicalSchemaMappingCollection;
00025 
00026 /// \brief
00027 /// FdoXmlFlags defines various options for serializing and deserializing
00028 /// FDO element to and from XML Documents.
00029 class FdoXmlFlags : public GisIDisposable
00030 {
00031 public:
00032     /// \brief
00033     /// The FdoXmlFlags::ErrorLevel determines how strict the error reporting 
00034     /// is when a Feature Schema is read from an XML Document. For each errorLevel a 
00035     /// certain level of round-trip fidelity is guaranteed if the read succeeds.
00036     /// 
00037     /// \param ErrorLevel_High 
00038     /// the read fails with an exception when the 
00039     /// Feature Schema cannot be read without alteration. If the Feature Schema 
00040     /// is read successfully from document A and then written to document B, 
00041     /// documents A and B are guaranteed to be identical. This errorLevel should be 
00042     /// used when no alterations to the Feature Schema can be tolerated
00043     /// \param ErrorLevel_Normal 
00044     /// fails if the Feature Schema cannot be read 
00045     /// without changing the domain of its conforming instance documents. If the 
00046     /// Feature Schema is read successfully from document A and then written to 
00047     /// document B, any instance document that conforms to the document A schema 
00048     /// will also conform to the document B schema. Any instance document that does
00049     /// not conform to A does not conform to B. However, documents A and B will not 
00050     /// necessarily be identical.
00051     /// \param ErrorLevel_Low 
00052     /// similar to ErrorLevel_Normal except that the 
00053     /// instance document domain is allowed to grow. If the Feature Schema is read 
00054     /// successfully from document A and then written to document B, any instance 
00055     /// document that conforms to the document A schema will also conform to the 
00056     /// document B schema. However a document that does not conform to the A schema 
00057     /// may or may not conform to the B schema.
00058     /// \param ErrorLevel_VeryLow 
00059     /// the read succeeds even if no level of 
00060     /// round-trip fidelity is maintained. If the Feature Schema is read successfully 
00061     /// from document A and then written to document B, any instance document that
00062     /// conforms to the document A schema may or may not conform to the document B 
00063     /// schema. A document that does not conform to the A schema may or may not 
00064     /// conform to the B schema. This errorLevel is useful for reading schemas from 
00065     /// external sources into FDO when it doesn’t matter how much the schemas are 
00066     /// altered during the read.
00067     /// 
00068     enum ErrorLevel {
00069         ErrorLevel_High,
00070         ErrorLevel_Normal,
00071         ErrorLevel_Low,
00072         ErrorLevel_VeryLow
00073     };
00074 
00075     /// \brief
00076     /// Constructs an FdoXmlFlags object.
00077     /// 
00078     /// \param url 
00079     /// Input When writing  Feature Schemas, this specifies the 
00080     /// prefix for the target namespace for any schemas that are written. The XML 
00081     /// format for Feature Schemas is OGC GML, so a targetNamespace for the 
00082     /// xs:schema element is required. This namespace will be http://[url]/[schema_name].
00083     /// \param errorLevel 
00084     /// Input The error level for reading feature schemas.
00085     /// \param nameAdjust 
00086     /// Input true: apply name adjustment to all elements. 
00087     /// false: apply name adjustment only to elements with fdo:nameAdjust="true"
00088     /// 
00089     /// \return
00090     /// Returns FdoXmlFlags
00091     /// 
00092     FDO_API static FdoXmlFlags* Create( 
00093         GisString* url = L"fdo.osgeo.org/schemas/feature",
00094         ErrorLevel errorLevel = ErrorLevel_Normal,
00095         GisBoolean nameAdjust = true
00096     );
00097 
00098     /// \brief
00099     /// Sets the target namespace prefix, see FdoXmlFlags::Create().
00100     /// 
00101     /// \param url 
00102     /// Input the target namespace prefix.
00103     /// 
00104     FDO_API void SetUrl( GisString* url );
00105 
00106     /// \brief
00107     /// Gets the target namespace prefix, see FdoXmlFlags::Create().
00108     /// 
00109     /// \return
00110     /// Returns the target namespace prefix.
00111     /// 
00112     FDO_API GisString* GetUrl() const;
00113 
00114     /// \brief
00115     /// Sets the error level, see FdoXmlFlags::Create().
00116     /// 
00117     /// \param url 
00118     /// Input the error level.
00119     /// 
00120     FDO_API void SetErrorLevel( ErrorLevel errorLevel );
00121 
00122     /// \brief
00123     /// Gets the current error level, see FdoXmlFlags::Create().
00124     /// 
00125     /// \return
00126     /// Returns the error level.
00127     /// 
00128     FDO_API ErrorLevel GetErrorLevel() const;
00129 
00130     /// \brief
00131     /// Sets the name adjustment flag, see FdoXmlFlags::Create().
00132     /// 
00133     /// \param url 
00134     /// Input the name adjustment flag.
00135     /// 
00136     FDO_API void SetNameAdjust( GisBoolean nameAdjust );
00137 
00138     /// \brief
00139     /// Gets the name adjustment flag, see FdoXmlFlags::Create().
00140     /// 
00141     /// \return
00142     /// Returns the name adjustment flag.
00143     /// 
00144     FDO_API GisBoolean GetNameAdjust() const;
00145 
00146     /// \brief
00147     /// Sets the Schema Name as Prefix flag. This flag controls how
00148     /// an FDO Feature Schema name is generated when the schema is read
00149     /// from GML.
00150     /// 
00151     /// \param schemaNameAsPrefix 
00152     /// Input when true, the Feature Schema 
00153     /// name is set to the prefix from the xmlns namespace declaration for 
00154     /// the schema's targetNamespace. The target namespace prefix flag on this 
00155     /// object is ignored
00156     /// in this case. If no suitable namespace declaration can be found,
00157     /// the Feature Schema name is set as if this flag were false.
00158     /// Schemas cannot be round-tripped when this flag is true. Therefore, it
00159     /// may only be set to true when the current ErrorLevel is VeryLow.
00160     /// Caution must be observed when using this flag. Unpredictable results
00161     /// can occur if a GML Schema uses different prefixes for its 
00162     /// targetNamespace in different parts of the schema.
00163     /// 
00164     FDO_API void SetSchemaNameAsPrefix( GisBoolean schemaNameAsPrefix );
00165 
00166     /// \brief
00167     /// Gets the Schema Name as Prefix flag.
00168     /// 
00169     /// \return
00170     /// Returns the Schema Name as Prefix flag.
00171     /// 
00172     FDO_API GisBoolean GetSchemaNameAsPrefix() const;
00173 
00174     /// \brief
00175     /// Sets the Use GML ID flag.
00176     /// 
00177     /// \param schemaNameAsPrefix 
00178     /// Input when true, the feature id ( fid in GML 2, gml:id in GML 3)
00179     /// becomes the identity property of all feature classes.
00180     /// 
00181     FDO_API void SetUseGmlId( GisBoolean schemaNameAsPrefix );
00182 
00183     /// \brief
00184     /// Gets the Use GML ID flag.
00185     /// 
00186     /// \return
00187     /// Returns the Use GML ID flag.
00188     /// 
00189     FDO_API GisBoolean GetUseGmlId() const;
00190 
00191     /// \brief
00192     /// Sets the Schema Mapping Overrides for translating schemas 
00193     /// between GML and FDO. 
00194     /// 
00195     /// \param mappings 
00196     /// Input the Schema Mapping Overrides. This collection
00197     /// can contain an FdoXmlSchemaMapping element for each Feature Schema that
00198     /// may be written or read. When a Feature Schema is read or written to or 
00199     /// from GML, this collection is checked for an FdoXmlSchemaMapping item named 
00200     /// the same as the feature schema. If present, the hints in this item 
00201     /// affect how the feature schema is read or written. The Schema Mapping 
00202     /// Overrides also control how features are read since they 
00203     /// can override the default correspondences between feature class names 
00204     /// and their GML element names.
00205     /// 
00206     FDO_API void SetSchemaMappings( FdoPhysicalSchemaMappingCollection* mappings );
00207 
00208     /// \brief
00209     /// Gets the current Schema Mapping Overrides.
00210     /// 
00211     /// \return
00212     /// Returns FdoXmlSchemaMappingCollection*.
00213     /// 
00214     FDO_API FdoPhysicalSchemaMappingCollection* GetSchemaMappings() const;
00215 
00216 protected:
00217     /// default constructor to keep linux from complaining
00218     FdoXmlFlags() {}
00219     FDO_API FdoXmlFlags( GisString* url, ErrorLevel errorLevel, GisBoolean nameAdjust );
00220     FDO_API virtual ~FdoXmlFlags();
00221 
00222 /// \cond DOXYGEN-IGNORE
00223     //Deletes myself
00224     FDO_API virtual void Dispose();
00225 /// \endcond
00226 
00227 private:
00228     ErrorLevel mErrorLevel;
00229     GisStringP mUrl;
00230     GisBoolean mNameAdjust;
00231     GisBoolean mSchemaNameAsPrefix;
00232     GisBoolean mUseGmlId;
00233     FdoPhysicalSchemaMappingCollection* mSchemaMappings;
00234 };
00235 
00236 /// \brief
00237 /// FdoXmlFlagsP is a GisPtr on FdoXmlFlags, provided for convenience.
00238 typedef GisPtr<FdoXmlFlags> FdoXmlFlagsP;
00239 
00240 #endif
